briefdescription.para: The number of legs in the trajectory.

detaileddescription.para: The number of legs present in this trajectory.
The different interplanetary leg types for this trajectory. These are stored in this vector, such that the appropriate leg types can be created for the different legs.

briefdescription.para: The vector containing the Ephemeris objects.

detaileddescription.para: This vector contains all ephemeris objects.

briefdescription.para: The variable vector for defining the trajectory.

detaileddescription.para: All the specific variables for defining the transfers are stored in this vector. Its size is determined using the number of legs and the leg types.
In this vector the positions of the planets at the visitation times are stored.
In this vector the velocities of the planets at the visitation times are stored.
In this vector the velocity of the spacecraft before visiting a new planet are stored.
In this vector the deltaV's associated with each leg are stored.
In this vector the gravitational parameters associated with each leg are stored.
In this vector the minimum pericenter radii associated with each leg are stored.
In this vector the semi-major axes of all the departure and capture orbits are stored.
In this vector the eccentricity of all the departure and capture orbits are stored.
The central body gravitational parameter.

briefdescription.para: Boolean denoting whether to include the Delta V of departure.
Boolean denoting whether to include the Delta V of arrival.

detaileddescription.para: The vector containing all the different interplanetary legs.
A temporary vector to store Keplerian elements for (repeated) use in the extraction of the ephemeris data.
A temporary object to store the Cartesian elements for (repeated) use in the extraction of the ephemeris data.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double numberOfLegs, const std::vector< TransferLegType > &legTypeVector, const std::vector< ephemerides::EphemerisPointer > &ephemerisVector, const Eigen::VectorXd &gravitationalParameterVector, const Eigen::VectorXd &trajectoryVariableVector, const double centralBodyGravitationalParameter, const Eigen::VectorXd &minimumPericenterRadiiVector, const Eigen::VectorXd &semiMajorAxesVector, const Eigen::VectorXd &eccentricityVector, const bool includeDepartureDeltaV=true, const bool includeArrivalDeltaV=true)
memberdef.name: Trajectory

briefdescription.para: Constructor with immediate definition of parameters.

detaileddescription.para:
Constructor with immediate definition of parameters.
numberOfLegs
the number of legs in the trajectory.
legTypeVector
vector containing the leg types.
ephemerisVector
vector of ephemeris pointers to the different planets.
gravitationalParameterVector
vector of the gravitational parameters of the visited planets.
trajectoryVariableVector
vector containing all the defining variables for the whole trajectory.
centralBodyGravitationalParameter
gravitational parameter of the central body.
minimumPericenterRadiiVector
vector containing the minimum distance between the spacecraft and body.
semiMajorAxesVector
vector containing the semi-major axes for the departure and capture leg.
eccentricityVector
vector containing the eccentricities for the departure and capture leg.
includeDepartureDeltaV
Boolean denoting whether to include the Delta V of departure.
includeArrivalDeltaV
Boolean denoting whether to include the Delta V of arrival.

Performs all the calculations required for the trajectory.
totalDeltaV
the total delta V needed for the trajectory.

briefdescription.para: Function to retrieve the value of the capture Delta V.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to retrieve the value of the capture Delta V.
captureDeltaV
Double denoting the value of the capture Delta V.
Double denoting the value of the capture Delta V (returned by reference ).

briefdescription.para: Function to retrieve the value of the departure Delta V.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to retrieve the value of the departure Delta V.
departureDeltaV
Double denoting the value of the departure Delta V.
Double denoting the value of the departure Delta V (returned by reference ).

briefdescription.para: Return intermediate points along the trajectory.

detaileddescription.para: Returns intermediate points along the trajectory.

Returns intermediate points along the trajectory, which can for instance be used to plot the trajectory.
maximumTimeStep
the maximum time between two points along the trajectory.
positionVector
Vector of positions along the orbit, space according to the maximum time step.
timeVector
The times corresponding to the positions.

Returns the maneuver points, times and sizes along the trajectory.
positionVector
Vector of the positions of the maneuvers.
timeVector
The times corresponding to the positions.
deltaVVector
the delta V required for each maneuver.

memberdef.argsstring: (double maximumTimeStep, std::vector< std::vector< Eigen::Vector3d > > &positionVectorVector, std::vector< std::vector< double > > &timeVectorVector)
memberdef.name: planetaryOrbits

detaileddescription.para:
Returns vectors containing planetary orbits, which are simulated using the ephemeris at the time of visitation.
maximumTimeStep
the maximum time between two points along the planet orbit.
positionVectorVector
Vector of positions along the orbit, space according to the maximum time step.
timeVectorVector
The times corresponding to the positions.

Returns vectors containing planetary encounters.
positionVector
Vector of positions of the encounters.
timeVector
The times corresponding to the positions.

Sets all the positions and the velocities of the trajectory class and the underlying mission leg classes to new values, that are obtained by extracting the ephemeris at the times that are now in the trajectory variable vector. This is required for re-using the class, without re-initializing it.

Sets the trajectory defining variable vector to the newly specified values. Also sets all the defining variables in the underlying mission leg classes to these new values. This is required for re-using the class, without re-initializing it.
trajectoryVariableVector
the new variable vector.

Returns the launch conditions, useful if additional information is needed regarding the launch of the spacecraft. This is for instance required for the TandEM problems of GTOP.
departureBodyPosition
the departure body position.
departureBodyVelocity
the velocity of the departure body.
velocityAfterDeparture
the velocity of the spacecraft after the departure maneuver.

briefdescription.para: Test to check if the size of all input parameters is correct.

detaileddescription.para: Computes the correct size for all input parameters. Returns true if they do not correspond to the expected values.

Prepares the velocity and position vectors required to store and pass all the planetary positions and velocities, spacecraft velocities and deltaV sizes. Does not set any values yet, but sizes them correctly based on the number of legs.

briefdescription.para: Check the size of the trajectory defining parameter vector.

detaileddescription.para: Checks the size of the trajectory defining parameter vector.

briefdescription.para: Prepare the legs and link the variables.

detaileddescription.para: A vector containing all the interplanetary legs is created here. The variables are linked to their corresponding legs and all these legs are prepared such that they can be calculated through. This only has to happen once, since all variables are pointers.
Extracts the ephemeris data and stores it into the associated position and velocity vectors.

briefdescription.para: Base class for computation of trajectories.

detaileddescription.para: This class can compute entire space trajectories of various kinds by concatenating different mission legs. It can compute the total deltaV, but also contains functions that can be used for plotting the trajectory and that of the bodies involved in the trajectory.
